Name: Protocol Adapter AMM (Sensor2AMI **)

Documentation.Description:
Basic Concepts

The Protocol Adapter Sensor2AMI gets a list of Landis+Gyr E350 DLMS/COSEM compatible energy meters from a configuration file, specifying communication related issues (TCP/IP address/hostname, TCP port, authentication type), performs cyclic reading sessions (continuous or timer-driven) collecting energy OBIS and computes power and energy values on two different integration intervals. At the end of each integration interval a ETSI M2M datagram is posted to the preconfgured EDAS instance.

Basic Design Principles

Sensor2AMI is a console program for MS Windows platforms, requiring .NET 4.0 or greater framework. The communication protocol to DLMS/COSEM devices is implemented through the Gurux Open Source components stack ( www.gurux.fi ). The SensorML communication is implemented by the IDAS FI-WARE Generic Enabler.
Documentation.Details:
Address/Protocol

The IP address of the existing instance is not public because it is currently used in the context of FINESCE project.

Commands

Run the Sensor2AMI program by command prompt, by typing: 

iamreader [/option]
  where option is:
  /a=    Authentication (None (default), Low, High)
  /host= host name.
  /l=    Loop time (-1: single run, 0: continuous, 1: 1 minute, 2: 2 minutes, etc...)
  /m=    Manufacturer identifier (default LGZ=Landis+Gyr)
  /p=    Port number or name (default 4059).
  /pw=   Password for authentication.
  /s=    Start protocol (IEC (default) or DLMS).
  /sm=   SitesMap file.
  /sp=   serial port.
  /t     Trace DLMS/Cosem messages.
Example:
Read LG device using TCP/IP connection.
IAMReader /m=lgz /host=192.168.200.20 /p=4059

Endpoints

This software needs to be downloaded, configured, and executed locally in the context of the metering network.
Documentation.Preface:
Within this document you find a self-contained open specification of the aforementioned Domain Specific Enabler (DSE).
Sensor2AMI is a software component providing the inter-operability between DLMS-COSEM smart meters such as Landis+Gyr E350 and the SOA/EDA via SensorML.

Please consult the appropriate pages on the FINESCE website in order to understand the complete context of the related FINESCE trials and this DSE.
Documentation.ReutilisedTech:
This solution uses DLMS-COSEM libraries from GURUX.
This solution uses IDAS to implement the SensorML compatible communication.

Overview:
What you get

The Protocol Adapter Sensor2AMI is an implementation of a solution for reading Landis+Gyr E350 DLMS/COSEM compatible electric energy meters and publishing application-specific power and energy profiles to Device Backend Management IDAS GE into the FIWARE architecture.
It self gathers metering data from a locally configured network of a/m energy meters, computes load and energy profiles according two independent integration periods and posts those data to an instance of IDAS GE according to ETSI M2M (SensorML 1.0) specifications.

Why to get it

You could use this DSE to interface Landis+Gyr E350 DLMS/COSEM compatible energy meters to IDAS GE, encapsulating the meter reading protocol complexity.
You could use this DSE when the compatibility with the DLMS/COSEM and SensorML is required.

Open Specifications

DLMS: “Device Language Message specification” - a generalised concept for abstract modelling of communication entities
COSEM: “COmpanion Specification for Energy Metering” - sets the rules, based on existing standards, for data exchange with energy meters
ETSI M2M Architecture Overview
ETSI M2M Specifications rel. 1
Downloads:
Sensor2AMI source code is available at: DSE%20FINESCE%20(sourceforge).zip

All Gurux Open Source source code is available at github: Gurux

IDAS GE is availabe from FIWARE catalogue.
Instances: An instance of this DSE’s reference implementation runs as a part of the FINESCE trial and is not publicly accessible.
